content.question: A small particle with a charge of magnitude <math alttext="q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is released from rest at point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and moves until it hits point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the potential difference <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> between the plates is known, which of the following correctly explains a method to determine the increase in kinetic energy of the particle?

choices.label: Use <math alttext="q delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>q</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to determine the decrease in the potential energy of the plates-particle system. That is equal to the increase in the kinetic energy of the particle.

Use <math alttext="the fraction q delta V, over d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>q</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math> to determine the decrease in the potential energy of the plates-particle system. That is equal to the increase in the kinetic energy of the particle.

Use <math alttext="q delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>q</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to determine the work done by an external force on the plates-particle system. That is equal to the increase in the kinetic energy of the particle.
